value.title: Chinese AI giant Baidu ups the ante on autonomous driving, plans to launch its first car with level 4 automation next year
value.excerpt: The Chinese AI giant’s electric vehicle being developed by its carmaking arm, Jidu Automotive, will have level 4 autonomous driving capability.

value.title: AI in closed-loop manufacturing can benefit edge computing systems: 4 things to consider in IIoT
value.excerpt: The convergence of AI and closed-loop manufacturing is coming. This could change IT thinking about edge IoT. Be prepared with these four things to know about it.

value.title: Chinese Dissident Ai Weiwei Dismissed Tennis Star Peng as Party ‘Soldier’
value.excerpt: Chinese dissident Ai Weiwei dismissed tennis star Peng Shuai as a “soldier” of the Communist Party, at a time when she appeared in state-media footage released to quell global concerns over her safety after she made allegations against a former top official.

value.title: Self-Driving Vehicles Are Here—If You Know Where to Look
value.excerpt: Glossy visions of an autonomous future always seem just out of reach. But two insiders say the technology is available on farms, and on clear, dry streets.

value.title: How no-code AI development platforms could introduce model bias
value.excerpt: Enterprises are embracing no-code AI development tools. But these tools abstract away processes in a way that could lead to issues like bias.

value.title: KEENON Robotics Showcases Full Line-Up of Service Robots at CES 2022
value.excerpt: KEENON Robotics Co., Ltd. (KEENON Robotics), the world's leading service robotics company, displayed its entire product line of service robots at Consumer Electronics Show (CES) 2022 running from January 5-­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­7th in Las Vegas.

value.title: Kokoon Nightbuds now use AI to help manage your sound sleep better
value.excerpt: Now, Kukoon has announced new features to improve your sleep quality further and claims its new algorithm uses AI to offer a deeper analysis to help you get more rest at night. Kukoon’s earbuds house crucial sensors to detect your sleep including an ...

value.title: How Machine Learning Observability Helps America First Credit Union Stay A Step Ahead
value.excerpt: America First Credit Union's Data Science Manager Richard Woolston shares how his team taps into machine learning observability to help ensure speed, inclusiveness and a great customer experience.

value.title: GM aims for self-driving car; Chevy unveils electric Silverado
value.excerpt: General Motors CEO Mary Barra said Wednesday during CES that the automaker hopes to sell self-driving cars to consumers by the middle of this decade. And Chevy is rolling out an electric Silverado.

value.title: How Abigail Annkah is using AI to improve maps in Africa
value.excerpt: As a university student, Abigail Annkah fell in love with mathematics, which soon led to her interest in artificial intelligence. After graduating from the African Institute for Mathematical Sciences, Abigail made it through the competitive process to become an AI resident at Google Research, Accra.

value.title: Pete Buttigieg wants vision tests for self-driving cars
value.excerpt: The US secretary of transportation wants to talk about innovation, infrastructure, and electric vehicles — but not about Tesla It’s something of a tradition for the US secretary of transportation to address the annual Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas and talk about all the ways that the government hopes to foster innovation in technology and transportation.

value.title: HealthLeap raises $1.1M pre-seed to reduce malnutrition in hospitals with clinical AI assistant

value.title: Can AI Emulate Human Creativity?
value.excerpt: AI has undoubtedly made a significant impact on human life but one aspect of it that still causes doubts is creativity. Some believe that creativity and AI cannot go hand in hand, but the truth remains that AI has already begun to take over creative tasks.

value.title: Chinese scientists build factory robot that can read minds

value.title: Roche, Microsoft Partner Improve Healthcare using AI and Cloud Technology

value.title: Ameca the robot is more human (and haunting) than I ever imagined
value.excerpt: If you poke a robot in the face, is it going to try to kill you?  Interviewing Ameca the robot during a demo at CES, I got my answer: No, but the face it makes when you get up in its personal space is haunting and mesmerizing in equal measure.

value.title: Google Prediction Framework addresses data pipeline drudgery
value.excerpt: Framework weaves together Google Cloud Platform services to simplify the implementation of prediction projects.

value.title: Cadillac’s new self-driving concept is a luxury loveseat on wheels
value.excerpt: The InnerSpace concept looks like a futuristic car from the outside—but inside, there's a two-seat loveseat surrounded by one of the widest screens we've ever seen, and no steering wheel or pedals.

value.title: MVP versus EVP: Is it time to introduce ethics into the agile startup model?
value.excerpt: Rather than developing a minimum viable product (MVP), companies should develop and roll out an ethically viable product (EVP) based on responsible artificial intelligence (RAI).

value.title: As third-party cookies fade, the cold start problem becomes an opportunity
value.excerpt: The demise of the third-party cookie could transform the cold start problem into an opportunity for businesses and their customers.

value.title: Ecovacs’ new Deebot X1 cleans your home and itself
